peripheralPage.name: _instance
peripheralPage.template: \t//! Base value for PCR (excluding MUX value) \tstatic constexpr uint32_t defaultPcrValue = DEFAULT_PCR;\n\n

intOption.name: minimumResolution
intOption.description: Minimum resolution for time interval setting
intOption.toolTip: This value is used as a minimum value check when setting the time interval.\n This is to prevent setting intervals with low resolution

peripheralPage.template: \t//! Minimum resolution for time interval setting \tstatic constexpr uint32_t minimumResolution = $(minimumResolution);\n\n

binaryOption.name: lptmr_psr_pbyp
binaryOption.toolTip:
When PBYP is set:
 - The selected prescaler clock in Time Counter mode or
 the selected input source in Pulse Counter mode, directly clocks the lptmr_cnr.
 When PBYP is clear:
 - The lptmr_cnr is clocked by the output of the prescaler/glitch filter

choiceOption.name: lptmr_psr_prescaler
choiceOption.toolTip: Configures the size of the Prescaler in Time Counter mode or\n width of the glitch filter in Pulse Counter mode

floatOption.name: clockFrequency
floatOption.toolTip: Determined from timer clock source and prescaler

floatOption.name: clockPeriod
floatOption.toolTip: Determined from timer clock source and prescaler

floatOption.name: maximumPeriod
floatOption.toolTip: Determined from timer clock source and prescaler

binaryOption.name: lptmr_csr_tms
binaryOption.toolTip: Configures the mode of the LPTMR

choiceOption.name: lptmr_csr_tps
choiceOption.description: Timer Pin Select for Pulse Counter mode
choiceOption.toolTip: Configures the input source to be used in Pulse Counter mode.\n The input connections vary by device

binaryOption.name: lptmr_csr_tpp
binaryOption.description: Timer Pin Polarity for Pulse Counter mode
binaryOption.toolTip: Configures the polarity of the input source in Pulse Counter mode

binaryOption.name: lptmr_csr_tfc
binaryOption.toolTip: When clear, lptmr_csr_tfc configures the lptmr_cnr to reset whenever lptmr_csr_tcf is set.\n When set, lptmr_csr_tfc configures the lptmr_cnr to reset on overflow

choice.name: lptmr_cnr is reset whenever lptmr_csr_tcf is set

peripheralPage.template:
//! Default CSR value
 	static constexpr uint32_t csr = 	 LPTMR_CSR_TIE($(lptmr_csr_tie))| 	 LPTMR_CSR_TMS($(lptmr_csr_tms))| 	 LPTMR_CSR_TFC($(lptmr_csr_tfc))| 	 LPTMR_CSR_TPP($(lptmr_csr_tpp))| 	 LPTMR_CSR_TPS($(lptmr_csr_tps));

intOption.name: lptmr_cmr
intOption.toolTip:
Default value for comparison
 lptmr_csr_tcf flag is set when lptmr_cnr equals the value in the lptmr_cmr and lptmr_cnr increments. 
 The hardware trigger will assert until the next time the lptmr_cnr increments. 
 If lptmr_csr_tfc=0 the lptmr_cnr will roll-over to zero

floatOption.name: lptmr_cmrPeriod
floatOption.toolTip: This is determined from lptmr_cmr register and clock frequency.\n When lptmr_csr_tfc=0 this is the lptmr_cnr roll-over period

floatOption.name: lptmr_cmrFrequency
floatOption.toolTip: This is determined from lptmr_cmr register and clock frequency.\n When lptmr_csr_tfc=0 this is the lptmr_cnr roll-over frequency

irqOption.name: irqHandlingMethod
irqOption.toolTip: This selection allow the interrupt handler for this peripheral to be installed using several different methods

peripheralPage.template:
//! Class based callback handler has been installed in vector table
 	static constexpr bool irqHandlerInstalled = ($(irqHandlingMethod) == 1);

intOption.name: irqLevel
intOption.toolTip: Sets the priority level used to configure the NVIC\n Lower numbers represent higher priorities

peripheralPage.template:
//! Default IRQ level
 	static constexpr uint32_t irqLevel = $(irqLevel);
